A) The 1980s

The spread of the meme took place primarily in 2016, aligning with events and cultural discussions surrounding feminism and political discourse in that era. The document outlines how it became popular in online communities and how it is often used as a critique of feminist discourse, particularly in the context of the 2016 U.S. presidential election. oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Options B, C, and D are not supported by the document and do not relate to the meme's actual background.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

The meme's widespread use, including captions that mock feminists, demonstrates a cultural message that belittles their concerns and portrays them as excessively emotional. Options A, C, and D do not accurately reflect the message conveyed by the meme, as they suggest a supportive or constructive viewpoint that is contrary to the mocking tone of the meme.

**Question:** What cultural phenomenon does the "triggered-feminist" meme primarily reference?

A) The rise of children's literature  
B) The reactions to feminist activism  
C) The popularity of animated GIFs  
D) The use of memes in political campaigns
reasoning:
To answer this question, we can refer to the oracle document (DOCUMENT id=0), which discusses the "triggered-feminist" meme in detail. This meme is centered around a confrontation involving a woman who is depicted as angry, often in response to supporters of Donald Trump. The document indicates that the meme is commonly used to joke about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists, thus directly referencing the cultural phenomenon of reactions to feminist activism.  

The distractor options (A, C, D) do not accurately capture the essence of the "triggered-feminist" meme. While children's literature and memes in political campaigns may be relevant contexts, they do not relate specifically to the content and purpose of this meme, which is focused on the feminist discourse.  

Thus, option B is the most appropriate answer, as it directly addresses the cultural context of feminist activism that the meme plays on.
oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

D) All forms of harassment are acceptable if they are framed as humor.
reasoning:
The "triggered-feminist" meme is associated with a broader discourse on feminism and the often dismissive attitudes towards women's issues, particularly in the context of humor and social interaction. Document 0 discusses how the meme portrays feminists as overly sensitive or easily triggered, often in a derogatory manner. The image associated with the question, showing a pyramid of sexual violence and its societal implications, reinforces the idea that dismissing these issues as mere jokes can perpetuate harmful attitudes. This supports option A, which highlights the misrepresentation of feminist concerns as mere anger. Options B, C, and D do not align with the critical social message being conveyed in the meme and its related imagery. 

Thus, the correct interpretation aligns with the idea that the meme highlights how women's legitimate concerns are often trivialized.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

C) Children’s books should focus on traditional gender roles.  
D) Humor is never related to societal issues like sexual violence.

The oracle document supports the understanding that the meme is highlighting issues of societal and cultural impact, specifically relating to feminist discourse. Options A and D misinterpret the message, while C is irrelevant to the context. Therefore, option B accurately captures the essence of the meme.

title: triggered-feminist_4
question_with_options:
**Question:** What potential counterarguments exist to the perspective shown in the "Triggered Feminist" meme?

A) Humor can be subjective, and what one person finds triggering, another may not.

B) Feminism has historically been about equality and may not always respond aggressively to criticism.

C) The meme simplifies complex social issues into a joke, ignoring deeper systemic problems.

D) All of the above.
reasoning:
The "Triggered Feminist" meme is typically used to mock feminists or left-wing activists, suggesting that they overreact to certain situations. Document 0 provides context about how the meme originated and its usage in political discourse, suggesting a negative portrayal of feminists. 

Option A presents a valid counterargument by highlighting the subjective nature of humor and reactions. Option B points out that feminism, at its core, aims for equality, which counters the aggressive stereotype perpetuated by the meme. Option C emphasizes that the meme reduces serious social issues to mere jokes, failing to address their complexity. 

Since all the options provide reasonable counterarguments to the perspective shown in the meme, the best answer is D) All of the above.

Option B, regarding accountability, is less relevant, as the meme primarily focuses on the reactions and perceptions surrounding feminism rather than accountability. Option D may tie in but is broader and less specific than A.

Thus, the best answer is A, as it directly relates to the meme's commentary on feminism and the social reactions it provokes.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin

The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread

On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

title: triggered-feminist_8
question_with_options:
**Question:** What social message is conveyed through the image of the "triggered feminist" sitting on a wall next to a picture of a man?

A) A critique of modern gender roles  
B) A humorous representation of societal debates on feminism  
C) A promotion of gender equality initiatives  
D) An endorsement of patriarchal values
reasoning: The image caption describes a woman sitting on a wall with a picture of a man, which relates to the "triggered feminist" meme discussed in Document 0. This meme often symbolizes confrontations between feminists and conservative viewpoints, exemplifying the tensions in societal debates on gender issues. The meme's context suggests that it is intended to be humorous and satirical, pointing to the stereotype of feminists being easily provoked in discussions. The most fitting interpretation given the options is B) A humorous representation of societal debates on feminism, as this aligns with the origins and usage of the "triggered feminist" meme in various online platforms. Options A and C imply a serious critique or promotion of gender equality which does not align with the meme’s comedic nature. Option D suggests an endorsement of patriarchal values, which is contrary to the feminist representation in the meme. Thus, the correct answer is B.

A) It reinforces the stereotype that women are overly emotional and less rational in political debates.

C) It suggests that men should be more understanding of women's perspectives.  
D) It highlights the importance of civil discourse in political arguments.
reasoning: The meme "triggered-feminist" is associated with the idea that women's anger or emotional responses in political contexts are mocked and ridiculed. The document details how the meme is used to make jokes about feminists and left-wing activists, indicating a power dynamic where women's voices are marginalized in political discourse. Options B, C, and D do not accurately reflect this dynamic as they suggest respect for feminist perspectives or understanding from men, which contradicts the essence of the meme. Thus, the relevant document supports the inference that the meme is tied to negative portrayals of women in discussions of power and status.

Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

title: triggered-feminist_8
question_with_options:
**Question:** How does the "triggered-feminist" meme encourage critical thinking in its audience?

A) By presenting arguments against feminism in a humorous way.  
B) By promoting feminist ideals through serious discourse.  
C) By invoking emotional responses to provoke thought about social issues.  
D) By providing statistical data to support feminist claims.
reasoning: The "triggered-feminist" meme, as described in the oracle document, typically portrays a woman in an angry confrontation, often used humorously to mock or criticize feminists and left-wing activists. The meme encourages critical thinking by invoking emotional responses, particularly through the exaggerated emotional expression of the woman, which prompts viewers to reflect on the dynamics of social conflicts surrounding feminism and activism. This aligns with option C, as it emphasizes the emotional aspect that leads to deeper contemplation about societal issues rather than straightforward argumentation or statistical support, which would align with options A and D. Option B is incorrect because the meme does not promote feminist ideals but rather satirizes them. Thus, the correct answer is C.

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

caption: a woman holding a sign with a picture of a woman

title: triggered-feminist_11
question_with_options:
### Multiple-Choice Question

What social conflict or tension is reflected in the "triggered-feminist" meme?

A) The disparity in societal attitudes towards men's and women's reproductive health.  
B) The effectiveness of various types of birth control.  
C) The role of humor in political discourse.  
D) The impact of social media on public protests.

### Answer
reasoning: The meme illustrates the contrasting societal responses to men's and women's birth control methods, highlighting a tension regarding gender equality in healthcare and reproductive rights. This aligns with the context in the document, particularly in how the "triggered-feminist" meme has been used to comment on feminist issues and social attitudes. The other options, while related to social issues, do not directly address the specific conflict depicted in the meme regarding reproductive health disparities. Therefore, option A is the most relevant.

### Question
What viewpoint does the meme "Triggered Feminist" primarily convey regarding societal attitudes toward gender issues?

A) It promotes a critical view of feminist perspectives by depicting a feminist as overly emotional and easily triggered.  
B) It advocates for the rights of women and portrays feminism positively.  
C) It suggests that gender equality has already been achieved and that feminism is unnecessary.  
D) It emphasizes the importance of men's rights in discussions about gender.

### Answer
reasoning: The meme "Triggered Feminist" is centered around the portrayal of a woman who is depicted as angry and confrontational, often used in contexts that mock feminist views and suggest they are overly sensitive or "triggered." This aligns with option A, which indicates that it promotes a critical view of feminist perspectives by depicting a feminist as overly emotional and easily triggered. The other options do not reflect the primary message conveyed by the meme, as they either support feminist views or suggest a non-critical stance on gender issues. The context provided in the document highlights how the meme has been used to satirize feminist arguments, reinforcing the idea in option A.

Other options do not accurately reflect the tone and intent of the meme as described in the oracle document. Thus, option B is the correct answer.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

question_with_options:
### Question:
How does the meaning of the text in the meme change when it is viewed without the accompanying image of the woman?

A) It emphasizes a humorous rejection of gender norms.  
B) It conveys a serious commentary on societal expectations of women.  
C) It becomes unclear and loses its satirical tone.  
D) It suggests a supportive stance towards traditional gender roles.  

### Answer:
reasoning: The accompanying image of the woman adds a specific emotional context, highlighting a humorous rejection of unsolicited opinions on gender expression. Without the image, the text alone may lose its satirical tone, making it less effective in conveying the meme's intended humorous critique of societal norms. The document provides information about how memes often use visuals to enhance meaning, reinforcing that the visual element is crucial for the humor to resonate fully. Therefore, the correct answer is C, as the text alone may not convey the intended humor without the image.

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

A) It suggests that women are overly emotional and irrational.  
B) It promotes the idea that women should express their emotions freely.  
C) It highlights the importance of women in political discourse.  
D) It aims to empower women by addressing their concerns.
reasoning: The meme titled "triggered-feminist" is rooted in a context that portrays women, particularly feminists, as being easily provoked or overly emotional, which is a common stereotype used in satire and humor. Document 0 explains the origin of the meme, indicating that it is used to "trigger" feminists and is associated with a negative portrayal of women in confrontational contexts. Therefore, option A, which posits that the meme suggests women are overly emotional and irrational, aligns well with the social commentary evident in the meme's humor. Other options do not accurately reflect the critical and mocking tone of the meme.
oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

title: triggered-feminist_15
question_with_options:
**Question:** What cultural message does the "triggered-feminist" meme convey in relation to feminism and women's rights?

A) It promotes women's empowerment and body positivity.  
B) It satirizes and mocks feminists, portraying them as overly sensitive.  
C) It highlights the importance of gender equality in society.  
D) It encourages discussions about women's rights and equality.
reasoning: The meme "triggered-feminist" originates from a video where a woman argues about women's issues, and it has been widely used to create humor at the expense of feminists, suggesting they are easily triggered by certain topics. This aligns with option B, which states that it satirizes and mocks feminists. The other options (A, C, D) suggest positive portrayals of feminism and women's rights, which are not consistent with the cultural context of the meme. The document describes how the meme has been used in various contexts to poke fun at feminists rather than support them, reinforcing the idea that this meme conveys a mocking perspective on feminism.

question_with_options:
**Question:** What cultural message does the meme "triggered-feminist_15" convey regarding societal divisions?

A) It promotes unity among feminists and their supporters.  
B) It mocks perceived elitism within feminist movements.  
C) It encourages dialogue between opposing viewpoints.  
D) It highlights the importance of personal expression in fashion.
reasoning: The meme conveys a cultural message of division, particularly highlighting the perceived exclusionary attitudes within feminist movements. The phrase "YOU CAN'T SIT WITH US" suggests a sense of elitism or gatekeeping, while the image of the woman with the gun implies a rejection of that elitism, indicating that she does not want to conform to these societal expectations. This aligns with the context provided in the oracle document, which discusses how the "Triggered Feminist" meme is often used to mock feminist perspectives, thus supporting option B. The other options do not fit the contextual clues or the general tone of the meme.

Option D misrepresents the text's intent by framing it as a political statement, which is not inherent in the phrase alone.

On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

caption: a cartoon character with a red cape and a red tie

title: triggered-feminist_16
question_with_options:
**Question:** What cultural message does the meme "triggered-feminist_16" convey through its imagery of a cartoon character with a red cape and a red tie?

A) It promotes the idea that feminists are overly sensitive and easily provoked.  
B) It advocates for superhero-like traits in feminists to combat societal issues.  
C) It suggests that feminism is a form of political correctness that needs to be challenged.  
D) It glorifies leftist activism as a heroic endeavor against oppression.
reasoning: The meme "triggered-feminist" is rooted in the cultural narrative that portrays feminists as easily offended, which is evident in the use of the term "triggered" associated with the image of an angry woman confronting Trump supporters, as described in the oracle document. The phrase "Did you just assume my gender?" further exemplifies this perception of feminists being overly sensitive. The image caption with a cartoon character in a red cape and tie likely represents a mockery of this image, aligning with option A, which emphasizes that feminists are seen as overly sensitive and easily provoked. Therefore, the relevant document is the oracle document that details the origins and spread of the "triggered-feminist" meme, while the distractors do not align closely with the main cultural message conveyed by the meme.

**Question:** What cultural message does the meme "triggered-feminist_16" convey about gender dynamics?

A) It promotes the idea that misandry is a false concept.

D) It suggests that misandry can be fabricated for political gain.
reasoning:
The meme "triggered-feminist_16" includes a caption that states "misandry isn't real but we can make it real," indicating a satirical stance on gender dynamics, particularly the concept of misandry. This aligns with the cultural discussions surrounding the "Triggered Feminist" image, which often critiques or mocks feminist views by suggesting they are overly sensitive or reactive. The document provides context about the "Triggered Feminist" meme being used to joke about "triggering" feminists, which supports the interpretation of option D as conveying that misandry can be fabricated for political purposes. Other options do not directly relate to the essence of this particular meme as they either misinterpret its intent or do not align with the provided context.  

Thus, the correct answer is D.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

**Question:** What message is conveyed through the combination of the image and text in the meme titled "triggered-feminist_20"?

A) The woman is celebrating a radical feminist ideology.  
B) The woman is expressing regret about her beliefs.  
C) The woman is joking about possibly being a radical feminist in a humorous or sarcastic way.  
D) The woman is showing her support for traditional gender roles.
reasoning: The meme features a woman smiling while suggesting she "might be a radfem," which indicates a humorous or sarcastic tone, often associated with radical feminist views. This is consistent with the "Triggered Feminist" meme context where images of women expressing strong emotions are used to critique or parody feminist ideologies, as noted in the oracle document. The image of an explosion in the background may further emphasize a dramatic or exaggerated tone, aligning more closely with option C. Options A and D do not align with the humorous nature of the text, and option B misinterprets the context. Thus, the correct message conveyed is best represented by option C.
oracle_doc:
triggered-feminist

About
Triggered Feminist, also known as Angry Feminist and Ficki Fiona, refers to a photoshop meme based around a still image of a woman with short hair and glasses appearing angry during a confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump. Online, images of the woman are often used in image macros, photoshops and animated GIFs in jokes about "triggering" feminists and left-wing activists.

Origin
On June 1st, 2016, The Alex Jones Channel YouTube channel uploaded a video titled "Trump Supporters Shut Down Protesters" (shown below). In the video, a woman with short hair wearing glasses is shown arguing with a man about statistics about SA against women. The original video was removed following YouTube's ban of all InfoWars channels in 2017.

Spread
On June 2nd, 2016, screencaps of the woman were submitted to /r/The_Donald,[1][3] introducing her as "Ficki Fiona." The following day, a thread about the woman was submitted to 4chan's /pol/ board, where many nicknamed her "Ficki Fiona."
On June 4th, 2016, Imgur [5] user antidamage posted the most popular usage of the meme, adding the word "triggered" in impact font to the bottom of the image. Within five years, the post received more than 13,500 views (shown below).

On November 10th, 2016, the Tugboat Facebook[2] page posted an image macro of the woman with the caption "Did you just assume my gender?" (shown below).
On November 19th, 2017, YouTuber PewDiePie used the image of the woman for the thumbnail on a video about microaggressions (shown below).
On March 13th, 2019, Donald Trump Jr. tweeted a photoshopped image of Captain Marvel (played by Brie Larson) superimposed with the woman's head and the caption "Captain Triggered" (shown below). Shortly after, the tweet was highlighted by the @WeWuzBoomers[4] Twitter feed.

title: triggered-feminist_20
question_with_options:
**Question:** What potential counterarguments exist to the perspective shown in the "Triggered Feminist" meme?

A) Feminism is a diverse movement with various interpretations and goals.  
B) The meme represents an accurate depiction of all feminists.  
C) The image promotes understanding between different political perspectives.  
D) The meme is intended to provoke and has no basis in actual feminist beliefs.
reasoning: To analyze the counterarguments to the perspective shown in the "Triggered Feminist" meme, we refer to the guidance provided in the oracle document. The document discusses how the meme depicts a woman in confrontation with supporters of Donald Trump, which is often used to mock or diminish feminist viewpoints. Option A points out the diversity within feminism, suggesting that the meme oversimplifies and misrepresents feminist beliefs. Option B claims the meme is an accurate depiction, which is not a counterargument but rather reinforces the meme's perspective. Option C suggests the meme promotes understanding, which contradicts the mocking nature of the meme. Option D states that the meme is intended to provoke, aligning with the analysis of how it is used in online contexts but does not serve as a true counterargument to the feminist perspective. Thus, the strongest counterargument is A, emphasizing the complexity of feminist thought.

title: triggered-feminist_20
question_with_options:
**Question:** What potential counterarguments exist to the perspective shown in the "Triggered Feminist" meme that portrays feminists as overly emotional or irrational?

A) Feminism advocates for gender equality and addresses systemic issues.

B) The meme is a humorous portrayal that does not reflect real beliefs.

C) The woman in the meme is actually supportive of traditional gender roles.

D) Most feminists do not engage in public protests or discussions.
reasoning: The relevant document is the oracle document, which explains the origin and spread of the "Triggered Feminist" meme and its common usage to mock feminists. The meme presents feminists as overly emotional and irrational, particularly in confrontational situations. A counterargument to this perspective is option A, which highlights that feminism advocates for gender equality and addresses systemic issues, countering the stereotype presented in the meme. Options B, C, and D do not effectively counter the argument made by the meme, as they either misrepresent the issue or fail to address it adequately. Thus, the most plausible counterargument is that feminism is fundamentally about equality, which directly challenges the negative portrayal.

title: triggered-feminist_20
question_with_options:
**Question:** What potential counterarguments exist to the perspective shown in the "triggered-feminist" meme, which suggests that feminists are overly sensitive or easily "triggered"?

A) Feminism aims to address systemic inequalities and injustices, which requires emotional responses to highlight their significance.  
B) The meme depicts a specific incident that lacks broader context on feminist activism.  
C) Feminists often engage in constructive dialogue rather than simply being reactive.  
D) All of the above.
reasoning:
The meme "triggered-feminist" highlights a stereotype about feminists being overly sensitive, yet there are several counterarguments that can be made. Document 0 provides context about the origin and spread of this meme, which focuses on portraying a woman as angry during a confrontation with Trump supporters. 

Option A addresses the importance of emotional engagement in activism, suggesting that such reactions are valid responses to systemic issues. Option B focuses on the lack of broader context regarding feminist activism, indicating that the meme oversimplifies a complex topic. Option C highlights the constructive nature of feminist dialogue, countering the stereotype of feminists as merely reactive. Therefore, all options provide valid counterarguments to the perspective shown in the meme, making D the correct choice.

The reasoning incorporates insights from Document 0 about the meme's context and the portrayal of feminists, affirming the relevance of the options presented.
